description.narrative: (i) Increased generation of Renewable power: The GOB has set a target to increase the share of power generation attributed to Renewable energy sources in Brazil to 20 percent from current 12 percent of installed capacity. The Project is expected to help Brazil meet this target. (ii) Contribution to Climate Change Mitigation: The Project helps mitigate adverse climate change impacts by helping Brazil achieve a balanced energy mix through the use of Renewable resources. With current operational projects and projects under development, the Company is expected to avoid approximately 700 thousand tons of CO2 emission annually by FY2018. (iii) Employment: The Project will generate additional local employment during construction (largely in Northeast Brazil) and permanent employment during operations. (iv) Private Sector Development in Renewable Energy: IFC''s investment is expected to help attract international investors to Renewable energy projects in Brazil which will facilitate the growth of private companies in this sector in Brazil.

Established in August 2011, CPFL Energias Renovaveis S.A. (CPFLR, the Company) is a company that develops, constructs and operates Renewable energy power projects in Brazil. Its strategy focuses on generating power mainly from wind, small hydro (less than 30 MWs of capacity) and biomass sources. CPFLR has 1.15 GW of operating projects, 582 MW under construction and 3.8 GW under different stages of development. The Project involves the financing of 530 MW of Renewable energy projects in CPFLRs 3.8 GW pipeline that are currently in advanced stages of development. The total cost to develop and construct the power plants is estimated to be R$2.54 billion (about US$1.25 billion). The implementation of the Project will result in significant growth in CPFLRs operating capacity and will contribute to Brazils energy matrix diversification. To fund its share of equity in the projects, CPFLR has raised R$300 million (~US$148 million) through an IPO. In addition to the primary raise the IPO also comprised a secondary sale by existing shareholders. In total the size of the IPO was R$900 million (US$443 million). Through this IPO, its shares will get listed in the Novo-Mercado segment of BOVESPA. IFCs equity investment of R$150 million (~US$74 million equivalent) accounted for a part of the proposed financial plan for upcoming projects. This investment has resulted in IFCs shareholding of approximately 2.7 percent in CPFLR.

name.narrative: The Project comprises of several projects spread in different parts of Brazil, including in frontier areas of Northeast Brazil.
